name: Sound Forge Pro Sound Data File

description: After editing an audio file with Sound Forge Pro (version 7 or earlier), the software automatically creates an SFL data file in the same directory as the WAV file. Additionally, it uses the same name as the audio file but with the .sfl file extension. For example, an SFL file for an example.wav file is named example.sfl .
NOTE: Sonic Foundry initially developed Sound Forge Pro until Sony acquired the software in 2003. Then, MAGIX acquired Sound Forge Pro in 2016.
